data.title: Spooktacular
data.text: Being a local I wanted to try a ghost tour of my town. Great history lesson with an eerie twist.  Jordan was an amazing guide.  Very informative and entertaining.  If you want to learn about Lancaster and it's ghosts... this is for you.   Ask for Jordan it and he is totally worth it!!!

data.title: Only 2 Actual Ghost Stories
data.text:
Although our guide was well seasoned in the history of Lancaster and its history, he sounded like a wikipedia article read by a male Siri.  He was long-winded and sadly we almost bailed before the end of the tour.  (This was our 6th ghost tour of different cities and this one was not good).
We give it 2 stars only because our guide did indeed know the history of the area.

data.title: Fun tour, TERRIBLE parking!
data.text: It is hard to review the tour outside of our experience in downtown Lancaster, which was extremely upsetting (enter the berate, screaming and cursing parking attendant), but taking that experience entirely out of the picture, the tour itself was okay.  We arrived with 20 minutes to spare and drove through the intersection where the tour departs from 3x in a search for parking.  Finally entered a deck only to have a nightmare leaving after the tour.  But again, taking that out of the picture, the tour itself was enjoyable.  Angela was our guide, and she seemed very interested in the paranormal and was a decent storyteller.  It was an extremely hot and humid night out so if we could’ve been more comfortable I might’ve enjoyed the stories better- however obviously since the tour guides can’t control the weather (haha), one has to endure the heat and humidity for a good ghost tale.  Also Lancaster seems like a “rough” city compared to others we have visited in on our travels.  We saw countless homeless people on the streets, some begging for money, some just sleeping on the ground.  It was a bit disconcerting, but again, not in the control of the Ghost Tour- just be prepared with a response to frequent requests for money.  My 9 yo enjoyed the ghost stories on the tour and even had us holding her hand because she was a bit frightened at times.  The tour talked just a bit about the history of the area but mostly focused on stories of paranormal activity in Lancaster.  We aren’t believers in that sort of thing and mainly went for the fun story telling element which didn’t disappoint.  The tour lasted right at the promised amount of time (1.5 hours) and was entertaining- some stories more so than others.  The walk around town was a pleasant way to discover a new city and some of its quirks.  It was a bit overpriced for the experience, but would recommend to others in the area except that the parking situation was a nightmare and that definitely would affect my decision to do the tour again.  Might try the Strausburg tour instead which is more rural and perhaps might not be as nightmarish to navigate.

data.title: Fun and Interesting Walking Tour
data.text: My mom and I went on the tour during the week in late June. Our guide Jordan was very friendly and entertaining. I have lived in Lancaster County my whole life, but I learned a lot of things that I never heard before. Some of the tour is about ghosts, some of it is jut spooky history of Lancaster. The tour was appropriate for a range of ages.

data.title: Ghost Tour of Lancaster
data.text: Donna, our guide, was so sweet and funny! She shared with us her own experiences as well as those involving the sites we visited on our tour. It was informative, a bit spooky, and a lot of fun. Great way to spend an evening.

data.title: Nice History
data.text: I thought this tour would be something different to do, since I was born and raised in Lancaster and returned for a visit. I was expecting to be scared by ghost stories, but it was about history and legend sightings. Lame, but was fun walking around Lancaster at night, in a group, without fear of being mugged.

data.title: More history than ghosts
data.text: A nice way to spend an hour or so in the evening.  Interesting history, nice walk, less than a mile from the square.  Group size around 10 was perfect.  Our guide was pleasant.  The tours are at 9pm.  FYI, there are no places open to grab a bite to eat after the tour in Lancaster city.  So, make other plans!

data.title: Knew script, but little else
data.text: Pleasant walk lasting about 1 hour 15 minutes.  It was historical, not scary.  Tour guide knew the script, but was unable to answer any questions from the group.  I was disappointed by the tour guide's lack of depth or breadth of knowledge about Lancaster.   Been on much better walking tours elsewhere.

data.title: Lancaster haunted history
data.text: If you like local haunted history, this tour is for you. Our tour guide Jordan, was a great guide. Not only did he tell you what the haunted history of multiple locations around Lancaster, but he also talked about what to expect from the individuals who see the group on the tour. I also appreciated his honesty and passion about the idea of ghosts and whether or not they exist. Overall, Jordan was fantastic and his devotion made the tour a great experience. Even after hearing the haunted history stories of Lancaster, my family and I had to stop by the cemetery the next day to snap some pictures.

data.title: Fun and educational .. A little scary !!
data.text: This is our second ghost tour ( historic Williamsburg) .. While it would be nice to see ghost one shouldn't base their reviews on it!! Our guide Jordan was great ,  has wonderful story telling skills .. Just being in such a historic area  one should feel the history and assume that they're in the company of our ancestors !! I enjoy the stories and the behind the scene knowlege that I'd never would have known !!

data.title: Save your money...and time
data.text: We went to this tour on a summer evening.  About 8 other people were there, so it wasn't crowded.  I have been on ghost tours before; I think they are fun.  It's all about the story telling,as our guide also informed us. I wanted to leave this tour after the first stop.  The way the tour guide delivered the information...slow, tedious, like the worst school teacher you ever had... droning on and on about things that were not even necessarily connected to the story....made me want to bolt.  But also the stories themselves...it did not seem like they had much to tell and whoever did the script was trying to pad the lameness of the stuff they had to talk about with a bunch of unconnected fill.  We left early.  No reason to subject ourselves to that more than we had to.

data.title: Date night!
data.text: We had a great time on this tour! We enjoyed hearing stories and historic info of our city!! It was a great date night activity!!

data.title: "Ghost Tour" More like a waltz down the block.
data.text: We didn't finish the tour because of how terrible it was. We didn't go into any of the buildings. We walked down the street, past the buildings, and by the cemetery. The tour guide was awful. The tour guide told ghost stories as we walked down the block. It was advertised that we would take a tour of each building. That did not happen. Save your $25 and go buy a corn dog.

data.title: Jordan is amazing!!
data.text: After reading some reviews we weren't completely sold on lancaster ghost tour. We decided to go anyway, we were so happy we did! Our tour guide Jordan was so well spoken, entertaining and a great guide. He kept our attention with every word which is a lot to say! So interesting , fun and a great time :)

data.title: History 101
data.text: We decided that doing a Ghost tour on Halloween would be a cool idea.  Well, it would have been a cool idea if this was a ghost tour. Our guide took us an an 1 1/2 history lesson of Lancaster. The 3 teens that I was with were beyond bored, they were angry.  My husband and I enjoyed the stories but there was nothing remotely scary about this tour. In the words of my oldest daughter. "This was an hour and a half that I'll never get back. I've been on other ghost tours in Virginia, boston and florida. They were real ghost tours. This one is a historical tour.

data.title: Intriguing stories
data.text: Our tour guide, Olivia, led us through Lancaster offering information on the town's history and ghost legends.  The tour was 1 1/2 hours and cost $16.  Very entertaining.

data.title: Nice night out
data.text:
This was our 4th Walking Ghost tour (Philly, Boston and Scranton) and this one was the one we liked least. Randy was our guide and he was very nice and personable but the stories were a little long winded and I found myself zoning out. They are not "Ghost hunter's" but more history stories. Randy was funny but kind of took the spooky element away. Talking about his renovations on his house and shows he watches. It was a beautiful night so it was nice to walk around. 
The other tour guides in other cities were much better, they kept the element of spooky going, a couple even brought evp's to do little experiments which were not part of of the advertisement. That was just a bonus. But they told very interesting shorter stories and kept our interest. Unfortunately Randy did not, although he was a very nice person. If you do get to one of the other cities I mentioned, you should do the tour there. The woman we had in Philly was incredible and my 2 teenagers still talk about her.

data.title: My first ghost tour
data.text:
Our guide Jennifer arrived in a black cape and candle lantern, very cool. It was less of a ghost tour and more of an historical tour with ghost stories attached to the local lore.   I like history , especially from pre colonial period to Civil war.  
Could have used a portable microphone and speaker.   Not as many stories as I would have liked; however,  I had a chance to walk around the main area of Lancaster city.  It gave me a 'landscape' of the city I would not have had otherwise.   
Our guide was knowledgeable,  answered questions and  very professional.
I liked it, I had fun  and  I would rec to anyone who wants to see a bit of the inner city of Lancaster city.
$15  each and I tipped $5.

data.title: Thank you!!
data.text: Lancaster Ghost Tour, THANK YOU! This was a fantastic experience. Very well designed tour with a nice mix of "history and mystery." Learned a lot about the history and the not so well known parts of Lancaster. The guide was stellar! Jordan made the night fun, filled with lots of chills, followed by laughter. Great night, we'll be back!!

data.title: Awesome in the rain
data.text: Had an awesome time on a great historical tour of Lancaster and and our guide was great.  She handled a number of issues with professionalism despite inclement  weather.  We would do the tour again in heartbeat.  Thanks again Lancaster ghost tours.
